1.text: A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed, and poureth out his complaint before the LORD. Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.

2.text: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.

3.text: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.

4.text: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.

5.text: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.

6.text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

7.text: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.

8.text: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.

9.text: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

10.text: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

11.text: My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.

12.text: But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.

13.text: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.

14.text: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.

15.text: So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

16.text: When the LORD shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.

17.text: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

18.text: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.

19.text: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the LORD behold the earth;

20.text: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

21.text: To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;

22.text: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

23.text: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

24.text: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.

25.text: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

26.text: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:

27.text: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.

28.text: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.
